terms.definition: A significant year in Indian law, notable for the enactment of the Transfer of Property Act and the Indian Easements Act.

terms.term: Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property
terms.definition: A criminal offense where someone deceives another to dishonestly obtain their property, causing loss or damage.
Official bodies or persons legally empowered to make decisions or take actions in a particular matter.
Entering or remaining on someone else's property without permission, with the intent to commit an offense or intimidate, insult, or annoy.
A legal principle stating that any property involved in a pending lawsuit cannot be transferred or dealt with in a way that would prejudice the rights of any party to the suit.
The act of creating a false document that has legal value (like a will, deed, or bond) with the intent to deceive or commit fraud.
Papers or records that have been falsified, altered, or created deceptively to mislead or commit an unlawful act.
Deceptive or dishonest methods used to gain an unfair advantage or illegal benefit.
The state of being confined in a prison as a punishment for a crime.
The main criminal code of India, defining various offenses and prescribing punishments for them.
A claim of ownership that is not legally recognized or enforceable due to defects or illegalities in its acquisition.
A demand or assertion of rights over a property that is not legally sound or supported by valid documentation.
Someone who has a legally recognized right to possess and control a property or asset.
A legally valid document that proves the transfer of ownership of a property from a seller to a buyer.
The legal punishments or penalties that result from committing an offense or violating a law.
A legal document, officially recorded with the government, that transfers ownership of property from one party to another.
The person legally entitled to possess and control a property or asset.
A government office responsible for registering property documents, marriages, and other legal instruments at a local level.
Any legal paper that records the change of ownership of an asset from one party to another.
An Indian law, enacted in 1882, that regulates how immovable property is transferred between living people.
Holding or occupying a property or item without the legal right or permission of the actual owner.
A legal term describing an agreement or action that is without legal effect from its inception and cannot be legally enforced.
